metadata.title: CVE-2018-17469 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Incorrect handling of PDF filter chains in PDFium in Google Chrome prior to70.0.3538.67 allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memoryread via a crafted PDF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17469` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 70.0.3538.67-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 70.0.3538.67-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 70.0.3538.67-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 70.0.3538.67-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 70.0.3538.67-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '70.0.3538.67-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
